intro: Psychotria sucrensis, commonly known as the Sucrensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in montane forests. Psychotria sucrensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
